snippet: In Venice Beach and the Westlake district, a new city ordinance puts pressure on vendors at two popular street markets.
abstract: City of Los Angeles officials pass ordinance that will forbid all unlicensed vendors at street markets except for those selling items that are considered to be of utilitarian value; new law is designed to crack down on sellers who bring with them threats of crime and an influx of people eager to sleep on city streets.
lead_paragraph: In Venice Beach and the Westlake district, a new city ordinance puts pressure on vendors at two popular street markets.

headline.seo: Los Angeles Cracking Down on Street Vendors
headline.main: From Boardwalk to Barrio, Los Angeles Cracks Down
headline.print_headline: From Boardwalk to Barrio, Los Angeles Cracks Down
